edu.osu.cse.mmxi.machine.memory
Class RandomizedMemory

java.lang.Object
  edu.osu.cse.mmxi.machine.memory.RandomizedMemory
All Implemented Interfaces:
Memory
public class RandomizedMemory
extends java.lang.Object
implements Memory

An implementation of physical memory where all words in all pages are initialized to random bytes instead of zeros. RandomizedMemory is stored internally as a short[][] for efficient random access to pages and words.

Method Detail

getMemory

public short getMemory(short absoluteAddress)
Description copied from interface: Memory
Retrieves the 16-bit word stored at the absolute memory address. A memory address is given by a 16-bit quantity where the upper 7 bits denote the page number and the lower 9 bits denote the offset within that page.

Specified by:
getMemory in interface Memory
Parameters:
absoluteAddress - 16-bit representation of the absolute memory address.
Returns:
the contents of the address.

getMemory

public short getMemory(byte page,
                       short pageOffset)
Description copied from interface: Memory
Retrieves the 16-bit word stored at the relative memory offset of the indicated page.

Specified by:
getMemory in interface Memory
Parameters:
page - the jth page in all of memory
pageOffset - the ith word of the jth page.
Returns:
the contents of the ith word of the jth page.

setMemory

public void setMemory(short absoluteAddress,
                      short value)
Description copied from interface: Memory
Sets the contents of the 16-bit word stored at the absolute memory address of the current page to a 16-bit value. A memory address is given by a 16-bit quantity where the upper 7 bits denote the page number and the lower 9 bits denote the offset within that page.

Specified by:
setMemory in interface Memory
Parameters:
absoluteAddress - 16-bit representation of the absolute memory address.
value - a 16-bit value to be stored in memory.
